title: Paris attack: How the terrorist's confusing profile fooled those monitoring him
summary: Already convicted of terrorism in 2018, Armand Rajabpour-Miyandoab kept telling investigators and those close to him that he had 'de-radicalized.' His psychiatric problems and the monitoring he had received since his prison release are at the heart of the interrogations. He stopped taking his medication in March 2022.

title: Macron lists France's priorities for tackling climate change at COP28
summary: France has launched an initiative to end private financing of new coal-fired power plants and signed a declaration to triple nuclear capacity by 2050.

title: Israel-Hamas war: In Tel Aviv's 'Hostage Square,' euphoria has given way to fear
summary: Relatives of Israelis still held captive by Hamas in Gaza are trying to keep up the pressure on the government, despite renewed fighting.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The frustrations and discreet solidarity of the Palestinian diaspora in the UAE
summary: In a country which normalized relations with Israel in 2020, and where freedom of expression is severely restricted, Palestinians are organizing collections for Gaza as an alternative to street mobilization.

title: Burkina Faso: Le Monde condemns government accusations and its suspension in the country
summary: After publishing an article on a jihadist attack, the authorities in Burkina Faso described our work as 'biased.' Le Monde defends the seriousness and independence of its investigation and deplores the sanctions taken by the Burkinabe regime against several media outlets.

title: Bangladesh faces its worst dengue epidemic on record
summary: Characterized in Bangladesh by long erratic monsoons and higher temperatures, climate change is promoting the reproduction of 'Aedes' mosquitoes, the main vectors of dengue fever, which this year caused over 1,600 deaths.

title: Nantes football fan dies after stabbing before Ligue 1 game
summary: The fatality occurred when several vehicles transporting Nice supporters were attacked by rival Nantes fans while on their way to the Beaujoire stadium before Saturday's game.

title: Montreal's organized crime scene in turmoil
summary: Bloody settlements of scores between rival clans have been escalating since the death of the Montreal mafia's godfather, who had managed to organize the criminal underworld.

title: In Istanbul, the disturbing disappearance of Syrian opposition figure and refugee Ahmed Katie
summary: The human rights activist, who was about to move to France with his family, has not appeared in public since November 27, when he had an appointment with members of the Turkish security services.

title: COP28: Heads of state call for action but remain divided on fossil fuels
summary: The countries meeting in Dubai for the 28th World Climate Conference have begun negotiating an initial working document, which contains a range of options from simply banning new coal-fired power plants to phasing out all fossil fuels.

title: What France's fast-food restaurants say about the country
summary: The increasing presence of fast food restaurants in some streets and towns illustrates the urban changes, income inequality and business creation opportunities in working-class neighborhoods.

title: Korea's soft power: K-food aims for the taste buds
summary: Korean cuisine − spicy, colorful and not too hard to reproduce at home − is pouring onto our plates. Popularized by TV series and K-pop, the cuisine is winning over young French adults, who are finding it in restaurants and grocery stores all over town.

title: Italy and Spain to meet in Euro 2024 group stage, England handed kind draw
summary: The competition will be held in Germany from June 14 to July 14, 2024.

title: Guinea-Bissau president calls deadly violence earlier this week 'attempted coup'
summary: At least two people were killed in clashes between the National Guard and forces of the presidential guard.

title: Bombs rain down on southern Gaza, where the Israeli army is now extending its offensive
summary: After a week's truce, the Khan Yunis and Rafah areas were bombarded. At least 200 Palestinians have been killed since fighting resumed, according to the local Ministry of Health.

title: Nations rally behind renewables at COP28 climate talks
summary: More than 110 nations pledged to triple the world's renewable energy within seven years.

title: 'Moms for Liberty' launch their conservative crusade against American schools
summary: The US organization is appealing to the American right and to candidates in the Republican primaries, but is struggling to win over parents and gain representation on school boards.

title: Gavin Newsom's unwavering support for Biden is a way to secure his political ambitions
summary: On November 30, the 56-year-old Democratic governor from California faced off against his Florida counterpart, Republican Ron DeSantis, in a televised debate that had no stakes but still formed a part of the 2024 White House race.
